result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn J Lemieux II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.   Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. No contact with the victim without their consent and the consent of the probation agent.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. This to include AODA assessment and parent education counseling.  Must write a minimum 100 word apology letter to the victim. This to be done within the first 30 days of probation.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of Extended Supervision apply to both counts.
Conditions of probation apply to both counts. Concurrent 15-CF-42.

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. No contact with the victim without their consent and the consent of the probation agent.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessment as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. This to include AODA assessment and parent education counseling. Must write a minimum 100 word apology letter to the victim. This is to be done within the first 30 days of probation.

timeConds.notes: 1 month stayed - to be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. Consecutive to any other sentence currently serving. 30 days to report but defendant needs to request furlough from revocation case to be released. Absolute sobriety during time out. Huber release granted.

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

Defendant Shawn J Lemieux in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Defendant Shawn J Lemieux in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea to Cts. 1 & 2. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 2. Court dismisses Ct. 3 but reads in for sentencing.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Atty Schaefer renews defendants request for 30 days out to find job. Defendant makes statement to the court. Court makes statement, imposes sentence.  Bond is no longer in effect.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 05-26-2015 03:30 pm

Defendant Shawn J Lemieux in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Defendant Shawn J Lemieux in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Schaefer asks that hearing scheduled for 4/30/15 be rescheduled to the same day as status in 15-CF-42. Court reschedules hearing. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 09:15 am.
